jobTitle: Job Posting Title Business Data Analyst (SFDC Administrator)
jobDescription: Job Description Summary As a Business Analyst and SFDC Administrator, you will be responsible for analyzing various internal and external data source to find meaningful patterns that can help us make data-driven business decisions. Duties include the following:Understand data structure of current CRM (Salesforce.com) and other available data sourcesAnalyze available and newly identified data set to: Baseline historical trends and Key Performance Indicators (e.g. sales funnel conversion ratio), Identify potential correlation patterns, Build predictive models on funnel conversion, forecasting, product tractions, product supportability etc.Build dashboard on CRM and Business Intelligence toolsPlan and execute ad-hoc data analytics assignments Perform system administrator function of the Salesforce.com CRM application  Create and execute queries and reports, maintain user roles, security and profiles  Maintain functional areas of contacts / relationship, accounts, opportunities, dashboards and reports  Work in a cross functional environment with various business groups and end users to identify, document, and communicate business processes Qualifications:Certifications Salesforce Certified Administrator (required)Certified Force.com Developer (preferred)Additional Job Description  Required education: BA/BS in Business Administration or Finance and Accounting  Salesforce.com administrator certification  2-5 years of strong operational experience with SalesForce.com  2-5 years of business analysis and/or statistical analysis experience  Excellent oral and written communications skills, ability to successfully work with all levels organization  Strong business acumen, superb knowledge of business processes and advanced skills in Excel.  Innovative problem solving, research, and analytical skills  Ability to successfully work in a cross-functional team environment  Excellent organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills  Ability to plan, organize, and prioritize assignments, and to meet critical and established deadlines; Ability to manage multiple assignments simultaneously
